Overview This section outlines how health research funds from various sources can be categorized and described based on their origin. ### Definitions & Key Terms **Funding Source:** This refers to an organization that provides financial support towards conducting healthcare-related studies. **Healthcare Sector**: Includes both public sector institutions such as hospitals and private clinics offering services related to human wellness management systems within Nigerian society's framework. #### Categories Of Funds For Healthcare Studies In Nigeria ##### Category A â€“ Governmental Support Fundings These include all forms of direct government subsidies given out through federal agencies like NIPER(National Institute Pharmaceutical Education) etc., which offer grants specifically aimed at advancing scientific understanding about diseases affecting populations across different regions throughout Africa especially West African countries including but limited too Nigerians themselves who reside outside these territories mainly due geographical constraints limiting access till now though this situation might change soon depending upon future developments regarding international collaborations between local researchers here inside our country along side other nations globally involved into similar projects focusing around common global challenges facing humanity today particularly those impacting low income communities worldwide irrespective where they live whether urban rural settings nor anywhere beyond just national
